How can I set a time lock on an identity using the Verus command line?

You can set a time lock on an identity using the `setidentitytimelock` command. The basic format of this command is:

```
verus setidentitytimelock "id@" '{"unlockatblock":absoluteblockheight || "setunlockdelay":numberofblocksdelayafterunlock}'
```

This command takes two arguments: the ID to be locked, and a JSON object specifying the lock parameters. The lock parameters can be either `unlockatblock` (specifying the absolute block height at which the lock will be released) or `setunlockdelay` (specifying the number of blocks to delay after the unlock).

Examples: > verus setidentitytimelock "id@" '{"unlockatblock":absoluteblockheight || "setunlockdelay":numberofblocksdelayafterunlock}' (returntx) > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setidentitytimelock", "params": ["id@" '{"unlockatblock":absoluteblockheight || "setunlockdelay":numberofblocksdelayafterunlock}' (returntx)] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
